metadata.title: CVE-2019-13286 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In Xpdf 4.01.01, there is a heap-based buffer over-read in the functionJBIG2Stream::readTextRegionSeg() located at JBIG2Stream.cc. It can, forexample, be triggered by sending a crafted PDF document to the pdftoppmtool. It might allow an attacker to cause Information Disclosure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13286` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.62.0-2ubuntu2.9
libpoppler-cpp0v5 - 0.62.0-2ubuntu2.9
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.62.0-2ubuntu2.9
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.62.0-2ubuntu2.9
libpoppler73 - 0.62.0-2ubuntu2.9
poppler-utils - 0.62.0-2ubuntu2.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: poppler package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.62.0-2ubuntu2.9').
